dt: {bc}a reference source in print or electronic form containing words usually alphabetically arranged along with information about their forms, {d_link|pronunciations|pronunciation}, functions, {d_link|etymologies|etymology}, meanings, and {d_link|syntactic|syntactic} and idiomatic uses
{bc}a reference book listing alphabetically terms or names important to a particular subject or activity along with discussion of their meanings and {d_link|applications|application}
{bc}a reference book listing alphabetically the words of one language and showing their meanings or translations in another language
{bc}a {d_link|computerized|computerize} list (as of items of data or words) used for reference (as for information retrieval or word processing)

quotes.t: I still read relatively slowly in Yiddish, with frequent recourse to a {qword}dictionary{/qword}, and my first year of graduate school found me at my desk till two or three in the morning every night …

Famed for his {qword}dictionary{/qword}, "Rambler" essays and {it}The Lives of the English Poets{/it}, Samuel Johnson (1709-1784) remains one of the most-quoted and carefully observed authors who ever lived.

et: borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}dictiōnārium,{/it} name for an alphabetized guide to the Vulgate, earlier {it}dictiōnārius,{/it} name for a Latin textbook in which words are grouped by topic (apparently coined by its author, the 13th-century English-born university teacher John of Garland), from Latin {it}dictiōn-, dictiō{/it} "speech, (in grammar) word, expression" + {it}-ārius, -ārium{/it} {et_link|-ary:1|-ary:1} {ma}{mat|diction|}{/ma}
shortdef: a reference source in print or electronic form containing words usually alphabetically arranged along with information about their forms, pronunciations, functions, etymologies, meanings, and syntactic and idiomatic uses
a reference book listing alphabetically terms or names important to a particular subject or activity along with discussion of their meanings and applications
a reference book listing alphabetically the words of one language and showing their meanings or translations in another language
